intro: Newtonia aubrevillei subsp. lasiantha, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, flame-colored flowers. The plant is notable for its ability to thrive in various soil types and its tolerance to drought conditions. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. The subspecies lasiantha is distinguished by its specific floral and foliar features compared to other subspecies of Newtonia.
